title: 109_s1603
content: The Act may be cited as the "Small Business Lending Improvement Act of 2005" and includes a National Preferred Lenders Program. The Small Business Act is amended to establish the National Preferred Lenders Program, allowing lenders to operate as preferred lenders in any state if they meet eligibility criteria set by the Administration. Lenders approved under this program can make loans for up to 2 years, with the possibility of renewal based on performance. Failure to meet criteria will not impact eligibility. The Administrator shall promulgate regulations to implement the program established under this subparagraph within 120 days of enactment. Eligibility of a participant to continue as a preferred lender will not be affected. The Administrator will implement the program established under this subparagraph. SEC. 3 amends the Small Business Act to increase the maximum loan amount to $2,250,000. SEC. 4 increases the authorization for fiscal year 2006 to $18,000,000,000. SEC. 5 introduces an alternative size standard. Section 3(a)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to establish an alternative size standard for loan applicants under section 7(a) or under title V of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958. The Small Business Act is amended to establish an alternative size standard for loan applicants under section 7(a) or under title V of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958, utilizing the maximum net worth and income of the borrower. Until an alternative size standard is established, the interim rule in section 121.301(b) of title 13, Code of Federal Regulations, will be used.
